solution_line_template: If 1 year is {days_per_year} days, and each year is divided into {seasons_per_year} equal-length seasons, then each season is {days_per_year}/{seasons_per_year}=<<{days_per_year}/{seasons_per_year}={days_per_season}>>{days_per_season} days long.

If an astronaut stays on the planet for {seasons_stayed} seasons, then they remain there for {seasons_stayed}*{days_per_season}=<<{seasons_stayed}*{days_per_season}={total_days_stayed}>>{total_days_stayed} days.
